questions.Question: Longitude is geographically significant to India because ________
questions.optionA: It determines the Indian standard time
questions.optionB: It has a bearing on the tropical climate of India
questions.optionC: It divides India into eastern and western zones
questions.optionD: It enables determining local time in eastern India
questions.solution: Longitude is geographically significant to India because it determines the Indian standard time. 82°30' E has been selected as the Standard Meridian of India because it is situated roughly in the centre of all longitudes and latitudes in which our country is located.

questions.Question: Which one of the following States in India has the broadest continental shelf?
questions.solution: Tamil Nadu in India has the broadest continental shelf. A continental shelf is the edge of a continent that lies under the ocean. Continents are the seven main divisions of land on Earth.

questions.Question: The northern part of the west coast in India is known as
questions.solution: The northern part of the west coast in India is known as konkan coast. It streches in Maharastra, Goa and some part of Karnataka.

questions.Question: Which one of the following shows the correct sequence of occurrence of the following towns/cities as one proceeds from west to east?
questions.solution: The following that shows the correct sequence of occurrence of the following towns/cities as one proceeds from west to east are Pandharpur, Gulbarga, Kottagudem, Vishakhapatnam.

questions.Question:
Arrange the following hills of southern India from north to south ________ 
1. Nilgiri
2. Cardamom
3. Nallamala
4. Anaimalai
Select the correct answer using the code given below ________
questions.solution: The hills of southern India from north to south are Nallamala, Nilgiri, Anaimalai and Cardamom.

questions.Question: Which Himalayan peak is also called as Sagarmatha
questions.solution: Mt. Everest is also called as Sagarmatha. The Mount Everest also known as Sagarmatha in Nepal and Chomolongma in China of the height of 8848m (29,029ft) above sea level is the highest peak in the world.

questions.Question: Which of the following is east of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands?
questions.solution: Indonesia is in east of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

questions.Question: What is the another name of Greater Himalayas?
questions.solution: The Himalayas consist of three parallel ranges, the Greater Himalayas known as the Himadri, the Lesser Himalayas called the Himachal, and the Shivalik hills, which comprise the foothills. Greater Himalayas are the innermost Himalayan range and are also known as inner Himalayas. They are also known as Himadri. Majority of mountain ranges and peaks lies in this range.

questions.Question: The largest southernmost single island in India is ________
questions.solution: The largest southernmost single island in India is Great Nicobar Island. Indira Point is the name of the southernmost point of Republic of India. It is situated on Great Nicobar Island in the Nicobar Islands, which are located in the eastern Indian Ocean at 6°45'10″N and 93°49'36″E.

questions.Question: The hill range that separates the state of Manipur from the state of Nagaland is known as ________
questions.solution: The hill range that separates the state of Manipur from the state of Nagaland is known as Barail hills. The Barail is the highest hill range in Assam.

questions.Question: Which of the following towns is located at easternmost?
questions.solution: Jamshedpur is located at easternmost. Jamshedpur is located in the south-eastern part of Jharkhand. Jamshedpur was formed on 16th January, 1990 after isolating nine blocks from the Singhbhum district. Jamshedpur is located in the Chhota Nagpur plateau and covers an area of 3533 square kilometers.

questions.Question: Which one of the following does not lie in Maharashtra?
questions.solution: Mandav Hills does not lie in Maharashtra. Mandav is a town and a nagar panchayat in Dhar district in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh.

questions.Question:
Which of the following is/are correct about the Rann of Kachchh?
1. It is a flat saline marsh land
2. It is in Rajasthan
3. It is the home of the Indian Wild Ass
4. It is a unique land formation supporting several singular species of fauna
questions.solution: The following that are correct about the Rann of Kachchh are that it is a flat saline marsh land, it is the home of the Indian Wild Ass and it is a unique land formation supporting several singular species of fauna.

questions.Question: Siwaliks are ________
questions.optionD: The plateau between Pamirs and Myanmar
questions.solution: Siwaliks are Foothills of Himalayan ranges. Siwalik ranges are the southern-most hills of the Himalayas, foothills of the mighty Himalayas. They mostly maintain a regular course from the River Yamuna to River Ravi on the south of the Western Himalaya.

questions.Question: Which among the following is the smallest state area wise?
questions.solution: Nagaland is one of India's smallest states, with a total area of 16,579 sq km (6400 sq mi). The Naga Hills run through this small state, which has Saramati as its highest peak at a height of about 12,600 ft.

questions.Question: How many Indian states share their boundaries with Nepal?
questions.solution: Five Indian states share their boundaries with Nepal. Indian states having border with Nepal are :- Uttrakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal and Sikkim

questions.Question: Which is not correctly matched?
questions.solution: Shimla is the capital of Himachal Pradesh.

questions.Question: Which of the following is India's military offensive against Pakistan in the Kargil war?
questions.solution: The Indian military operation against Pakistan in the Kargil war was "Operation Vijay" to clear the Kargill sector. The Kargil sector was reoccupied by Indian militaryon July 1999.

questions.Question: With which of the following country, India has a land dispute near Tawang?
questions.solution: Tawang is located in the state of Arunachal Pradesh, India. It is separated from China by McMohan line. However China consider the region as disputed land and denies to acknowledge McMohan line as international boundary.

questions.Question: In India economically exploitable lignite deposits occur at
questions.solution: In India economically exploitable lignite deposits occur at Neyveli, Tamil Nadu. It annually produces about 30 million tonne lignite from opencast mines at Neyveli in the state of Tamil Nadu in southern India and at Barsingsar in Bikaner district of Rajasthan state.

questions.Question: Himalayan mountain range is an Example of
questions.solution: Himalayas are fold mountains formed due to folding of sediments between Eurasian plate and Indian Plate. These are youngest fold mountain range.

questions.Question: Nag Tibba and Mahabharat Mountain Ranges are included in
questions.solution: Mahabharat nad Nag Tibba range are included in Lesser Himalayas. Lesser Himalayas are major eastwest mountain ranges along Greater Himalayas. These are also called "Himachal".

questions.Question: The second highest peak in the world is ________
questions.solution: K2, Chinese Qogir Feng, also called Mount Godwin Austen, called locally Dapsang or Chogori, the world's second highest peak (28,251 feet [8,611 metres]), second only to Mount Everest.

questions.Question: Yercaud, a hill station of South India, is situated on the
questions.solution: Yercaud, a hill station of South India, is situated on the Shevaroy Hills. It is located in the Shevaroys range of hills in the Eastern Ghats.

questions.Question: Indian desert is known as
questions.solution: Thar desert is located in North western part of India. It is also known as Great Indian desert. The rainfall here generally remains around 20cm.

questions.Question: The gap of a Mountain which provides natural path is known as?
questions.solution: A pass is a location in a range of mountains of a geological formation that is lower than the surrounding peaks. It acts as a natural path through the mountains.

questions.Question: The region which is a water divide between the Ganga and Indus river systems is
questions.solution: Ambala is the city located on the water divide between Indus and Ganga river systems. Any elevated area, such as a mountain or upland, separates two drainage basins. Such upland is known as water divide.

questions.Question: To which group do the tribals of central and southern India belong?
questions.solution: To Proto-Australoids group the tribes of central and southern India belong, the people belonging to the Proto-Australoid race came here just after the Negritos. Their sources are Australian aborigines.

questions.Question: The Coastal terrain of Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu is known as
questions.solution: Parts of Andhra coast and coast of Tamil Nadu together are known as Coromandel coast or Payan Ghat. It lies between Flase Divi point in A.P. in North and Kanyakumari in South.

questions.Question: Indian subcontinent was mainly a part of
questions.solution: Initially earth was a big landmass called Pangea which was surrounded by a large water body called Panthalasa. The big landmass was broken into two pieces known as Angaraland and Gondwanaland. India was the part of Gondwanaland.

questions.Question: Which of the following higher ground is not the part of Telangana Plateau?
questions.solution: Aravalli higher ground is not the part of Telangana Plateau. Aravalli hills are one of the oldest mountain ranges in world and they lie in North western part of India. Telangana plateau forms a part of Eastern Ghats, Western Ghats and Satpura range.

questions.Question: Which State has the longest coastline?
questions.solution: Gujarat has the longest coastline in mainland India. Its length is about 1600 km. But if we take all states & UTs, Andaman & Nicobar Islands have the longest coastline in Indiaabout 1962 km.

questions.Question: Duncan passage is located between
questions.solution: South and Little Andaman Duncan passage is a strait which separates South and Little Andaman. It lies just above the 11 degree.

questions.Question: The northern part of the west coast is known as ________
questions.solution: The northern part of the west coast is known as Konkan coast. Konkan, also called Aparanta, coastal plain of western India, lying between the Arabian Sea (west) and the Western Ghats (east). The plain stretches approximately 330 miles (530 km) from the Daman Ganga River north of Mumbai (Bombay) to the Terekhol River between Maharashtra and Goa states and Daman and Diu union territory in the south.

questions.Question: Which one of the following gives the correct sequence of places going from the east to the west of India?
questions.solution: The following places that gives the correct sequence of places going from the east to the west of India are Jorhat, Bhopal, Ahmedabad and Rajkot.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the capital of the union territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli?
questions.solution: Silvassa is the capital of the union territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli. The city has a large number of factories and industries providing significant government revenue, which allows the city to maintain a low level of taxation. The city was chosen as one of the hundred Indian cities in Narendra Modi's flagship Smart Cities Mission.

questions.Question: Which one of the following States shares boundaries with the maximum number of other States of India ?
questions.solution: Assam shares its boundaries with as many as seven states, apart from sharing international boundaries with Bhutan and Bangladesh. Arunachal Pradesh is in north, West Bengal is located in west, Nagaland and Manipur in the east whereas Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram in the south. Assam is the only state among the seven sisters which shares its borders with the rest of the six states that comprise the seven sisters.

questions.Question:
Which of the statement(s) given below is/are correct?
1. The continental shelves of Lakshadweep are originated due to coral reefs.
2. The continental shelves of western coast are due to faulting and submergence.
questions.solution: Both the statements given below are correct. The continental shelves of Lakshadweep are originated due to coral reefs. The continental shelves of western coast are due to faulting and submergence.

questions.Question: Which of the following sets of cities is located on the reference longitude for Indian standard time?
questions.solution: Kakinanda-Pondicherry is located on the reference longitude for Indian standard time. Kakinada is globally known for its sweet called kaaja. Along with these it is also known for its town planning. The Indian Standard Time (IST) passes through this city.

questions.Question: Nanda Devi peak forms a part of ________
questions.solution: Nanda Devi peak forms a part of Kumaon Himalayas located in Chamoli district of Uttaranchal.

questions.Question: In the north-west, India shares its land boundaries with which country?
questions.solution: In north-west, India shares its land boundaries with Pakistan running through hilly terrain in J&K, Riverine parts of Punjab, marshy Rann of Kutch and sandy wasteland Rajasthan.

questions.Question: India has a land boundary of about ________ km.
questions.solution: Total land boundary of India with seven countries 15,200 km. Its maritime boundary is 7516km.

questions.Question: Which of following city is situated in the farthest east?
questions.solution: Lucknow city is situated in the farthest east. Situated on the northern Gangetic plains of India, Lucknow is the capital city of Uttar Pradesh. The geographical location of Lucknow is between 26.50° North and 80.50° East. Lucknow is located at an elevation of 123 meters above sea level. This city was known by the name of Awadh during ancient times.

questions.Question: Which border line separates India from Pakistan?
questions.solution: Radcliffe line demarcates the boundary between India & Pakistan. It runs from mountainous Kashmir to riverine Punjab & then through sandy Rajasthan. It was published on 17 August, 1947 just after Independence.

questions.Question: Which of the following country is not a member of BRICS association?
questions.solution: Iceland is not a member of BRICS association. BRICS is acronym for association of five member countries:-Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. This association was set up in 2009 after Yekaterinburg summit in Russia.

questions.Question: India's neighbour country with minimum area is
questions.solution: Bhutan is the smallest neighbouring country of India on land with 38,394 km area. It ranks 137th in the World by area.

questions.Question: Indian Standard Time is ahead of Greenwich Mean Time by
questions.solution: Indian Standard Time is ahead of Greenwich Mean Time by 5.30 hours.

questions.Question: Economically exploitable lignite occurs in
questions.solution: Economically exploitable lignite occurs in Tamil Nadu. The development of lignite mines and lignite based thermal power stations has to be confined here.

questions.Question: Which of the following countries shares the longest border with India?
questions.solution: India shares a 4096 km long border with Bangladesh. States sharing their border with Bangladesh are as following :- 1. Assam (262 km) 2. Tripura (856 km) 3. Mizoram (180 km) 4. Meghalaya (44 km) 5. West Bengal (2,217 km)

questions.Question: India has longest international border with which country?
questions.solution: India has the longest international boundary with Bangladesh (4096.70 km). Country Length of boundary 1. Bangladesh 4,096.70 km 2. China 3,488 km 3. Pakistan 3,323 km 4. Nepal 1,751 km 5. Myanmar 1,643 km 6. Bhutan 699 km 7. Afghanistan 106 km

questions.Question: Economically exploitable gypsum occurs in
questions.solution: Economically exploitable gypsum occurs in Rajasthan. Gypsum is formed by the hydration of anhydrite.

questions.Question: Which of the following union territory of India has four districts but the border of its district do not meet with other district?
questions.solution: The union territory of puducherry has four districts namely Yanam, Puducherry, Karaikal and Mahe. These four districts do not share any border with each other.

questions.Question: Which of the following city located on Northern most Latitude?
questions.solution: Patna city located on Northern most Latitude. Patna is a city found in Bihar, India. It is located 25.60 latitude and 85.12 longitude and it is situated at elevation 57 meters above sea level.

questions.Question: Which of the nations are connected with Palk Strait?
questions.solution: A Strait is a narrow channel of the water joining two larger bodies of water, Palk Strait connects Bay of Bengal and Gulf of Mannar separating India and Sri Lanka.

questions.Question: Which of the following Indian state does not share International land border?
questions.solution: Madhya Pradesh is a state that lies in Central India, and does not share any international border. Indian States sharing their border with Madhya Pradesh are Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh.

questions.Question: Which is the highest peak to the south of the Vindhyas?
questions.solution: Vindhyas separates North India from South India. South of Vindhyas it is Anaimudi in Anaimalai hills which is the highest peak of South India. Its elevation is about 2695m.

questions.Question:
Consider the following mountain ranges:
1. Ladakh Range
2. Karakoram
3. Greater Himalayas
4. Zanskar Range
What is the correct sequence of these from south to north?
questions.solution: The correct sequence of these mountain ranges from south to north are Greater Himalayas, Zanskar Range, Ladakh Range and Karakoram.

questions.Question: Which statement is correct
questions.optionA:
Mahadev Mountains are in the west of Maikal
Mountains
questions.optionB:
Mahadev Mountains are the part of Karnataka
Plateau
questions.optionC:
Mahadev Mountains are inthe East of Plateau
of Chotanagpur
questions.optionD: Mahadev Mountains are part of Aravalli Range.
questions.solution: Mahadeo hills are in Madhya Pradesh which lies on the west of Maikal Mountains located in Chhattisgarh. Both of these hills are a part of Satpura range.

questions.Question:
Arrange the following ranges in order as they occur from north to south:
I. Pir Panjal
II. Karakoram
III. Zanskar
IV. Ladakh
questions.solution: The following ranges in order as they occur from north to south are Karakoram, Ladakh, Zanskar and Pir Panjal.

questions.Question: The northern plain of India is formed of ________.
questions.solution: Northern plain of India are formed due to depositional action of Indus, Gangetic and Brahmaputra river systems. These are formed by alluvial soil which is further subdivided into Bangar (old alluvium) and Khadar (newalluvium).

questions.Question: The correct sequence of the different sections of the Himalayas in terms of their stretch (in kilometre) in the descending order is ________
questions.optionA: Punjab Him., Kumaon Him., Nepal Him., Assam Him.
questions.optionB: Nepal Him., Assam Him., Punjab Him., Kumaon Him.
questions.optionC: Kumaon, Hlm., Nepal Him., Assam Him., Punjab Him.
questions.optionD: Nepal Him., Assam Him., Kumaon Him., Punjab Him.
questions.solution: The correct sequence of the different sections of the Himalayas in terms of their stretch (in kilometre) in the descending order is Nepal Him., Assam Him., Punjab Him., and Kumaon Him.

questions.Question: What is the name of India's permanent research station in southern hemisphere Antarctica
questions.solution: Dakshin Gangotri is the name of India's permanent research station in southern hemisphere Antarctica. It is located at a distance of 2,500 kilometres (1,600 mi) from the South Pole.

questions.Question: Panchmarhi is near the highest point on the range of
questions.solution: Panchmarhi is near the highest point on the range of Satpuras. Mount Dhupgarh or Dhoopgarh is the highest point in the Satpura Range and in Madhya Pradesh, India. Located in Pachmarhi, it has an elevation of 1,350 metres (4,429 ft).It is the highest point of Madhya Pradesh.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the main difference between the Western and Eastern Ghats?
questions.solution: Continuity is the main difference between the Western and Eastern Ghats. Western Ghats are continuous and can be crossed through passes only. But Eastern Ghats has been divided into several parts by large rivers.

questions.Question: India is the seventh largest country in the world and it covers a total area of approximately ________
questions.solution: India is the seventh largest country in the world and it covers a total area of approximately 3200000 sq. km. It is the seventh-largest country in the world, with a total area of 3,287,263 square kilometres (1,269,219 sq. mi).

questions.Question: Himalayan mountain range falls under which type of mountains?
questions.solution: Himalayan mountain range falls under Fold Mountain. Himalayas are fold mountains that were formed when Eurasian plate and Indian Plate collided. In the event ofcollision the sediments of Tethyian sea got squeezed and towering Himalayas were formed.

questions.Question: If India adopts two time zones based on 75°E meridian for western India and 90°E meridian for eastern India, which one among the following states of eastern India will be benefited most?
questions.solution: If India adopts two time zones based on 75°E meridian for western India and 90°E meridian for eastern India, Assam of eastern India will be benefitted most. Places located on the eastern side of India like Assam witness sunrise as early as 4.30 am due to single time zone. Sun rises very early in these eastern parts of India. Normally, there is a lag of about two hours in the sunrise of eastern part & the western part of India. In summer times, the sun rises 90 minutes earlier in the eastern part of India than the western part of India. Due to earlier sun rise & earlier sunset, these eastern states loose productivity because of the decrease in the office hours.

questions.Question:
Which of the following arrangements is correct according to their locations from north to south mountain ranges of Jammu and Kashmir:
1. Karakoram
2. Ladakh
3. Zanskar
4. Pir Panjal
questions.solution: The following arrangements that is correct according to their locations from north to south mountain ranges of Jammu and Kashmir, Karakoram, Ladakh, Zanskar and Pir Panjal.

questions.Question:
Which of the following organization composes
Topographic Map of India
questions.solution: A topographic map is characterized by large scale detail and quantitative representation of relief with the help of contour lines. It is prepared by Survey of India.

questions.Question: Mount Everest, the highest peak in the world, is located in ________
questions.solution: Mount Everest, the highest peak in the world, is located in Nepal.Mt Everest is highest peak of the world, located in a Northeastern part of Nepal. The elevation of Highest Peak Mount Everest has 8848m above the sea-level. Mount Everest is called “Sagarmatha” in Nepali or Chomolungma in Tibetan.

questions.Question: Which of the following processes is responsible for producing the sand dunes in western Rajasthan?
questions.solution: Wind deposition processes is responsible for producing the sand dunes in western Rajasthan. Sand dunes are the depositional features which are formed due to the deposition of sand particles carried by wind. A sand dunes shape depends upon direction and speed of wind.

questions.Question: Most Indians belong to the group ________
questions.solution: Most Indians belong to the group Caucasoid. North West Indians belong mostly to the Caucasoid race because of genetics and looks. Dravidians are genetically very distanced from all other racial groups so they can be considered their own race, but they have some Caucasoid influence.

questions.Question: Which of the following States has the largest number of people belonging to Scheduled Caste?
questions.solution: Punjab has the largest number of people belonging to Scheduled Caste. As per Census-2011, the State of Punjab, has the highest percentage of Scheduled Caste population amongst all the States of the Country. The Scheduled Caste population in Punjab is 88.60 lac which is 31.94% of the total population (277.43 lac) of the State.

questions.Question: Ten Degree Channel is between ________
questions.solution: Ten Degree Channel is between Little Andaman and Car Nicobar, about 77 miles to the South, is deep and clear. The Channel is approximately 150 km wide, running essentially along an east-west orientation. It is so named as it lies on the 10-degree line of latitude, north of the equator.

questions.Question: Which of the following is known as Sahyadri Mountain
questions.solution: Western Ghats is known as Sahyadri Mountain. It is a mountain range that covers an area of 140,000 km² in a stretch of 1,600 km parallel to the western coast of the Indian peninsula, traverse the States of Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat.

questions.Question: In which state is the Guru Shikhar Peak located?
questions.solution: The Guru Shikhar Peak is located in Rajasthan. Guru Shikar is located at a height of 1772 meters above sea level, and one can enjoy the view of Mount Abu region from this peak. It is 15 km from Mount Abu and a road from there leads almost to the top of the mountain.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements:
1. Cherrapunji is located on the south side of Garo hills.
2. Cherrapunji is about 1700 m above mean sea level.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: The statements that are correct are Cherrapunji is located on the south side of Garo hills and Cherrapunji is about 1700 m above mean sea level. Cherrapunji is a subdivisional town in the East Khasi Hills district in the Indian state of Meghalaya.

questions.Question: Which one of the following cities will never get the vertical rays of the sun?
questions.solution: Since Srinagar lies to the north of the Tropic of Cancer, it never gets the vertical rays of the sun.

questions.Question: West Bengal shares boundaries with how many foreign countries?
questions.solution: West Bengal shares boundaries with three foreign countries. The state has international boundaries with Bangladesh in the east, Bhutan and Nepal in the north.

questions.Question: The correct order of the given hills from west to east is ________
questions.solution: The correct order of the given hills from west to east is Garo-Khasi-Jaintia-Naga.

questions.Question: The highest point of the Nilgiri Hills is
questions.solution: The highest point of the Nilgiri Hills is Doda Betta. Doda Betta, mountain peak, the highest point in Tamil Nadu state, southeastern India, near Udhagamandalam. Rising to an elevation of 8,652 feet (2,637 metres), Doda Betta is a grass-covered hill that is frequently climbed by summer visitors, and the summit is accessible by automobile.

questions.Question: What do you understand by the term 'Doab' ?
questions.optionA: Where the delta of river begins
questions.optionB: Where two or more rivers meet
questions.optionC: Land between two separate river systems
questions.optionD: Land between two tributaries of a river
questions.solution: Land between two tributaries of a river means 'Doab'. The place where two small streams join together and results in the formation of a big river is called a doab. The small streams might be the tributaries of a river also.

questions.Question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
questions.optionA: Black cotton soil of north-west India was formed by the weathering of basaltic lava rocks
questions.optionB: Sedimentary rocks are distinguished from other types of rocks by the presence of distinct layers
questions.optionC: Granite has large crystals of quartz, feldspar and mica in it
questions.optionD: A metamorphic rock is softer and less compact than its original type
questions.solution: The following statements that is not correct is that metamorphic rock is softer and less compact than its original type. Metamorphic rocks form from heat and pressure changing the original or parent rock into a completely new rock.

questions.Question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
questions.optionA: The Western Ghats are relatively higher in their northern region
questions.optionB: The Anaimudi is the highest peak in the Western Ghats
questions.optionC: Tapi river lies to the south of Satpura
questions.optionD: The Narmada and the Tapi river valleys are said to be old rift valleys
questions.solution: The statement that is not correct is that the Western Ghats are relatively higher in their northern region. The Western Ghats are relatively lower in their northern region.

questions.Question: Indian Standard Meridian passes through the states of UP, MP ________
questions.solution: Indian Standard Meridian passes through the states of UP, MP, Orissa and AP.

questions.Question: Which state is the protectorate of India?
questions.solution: After 1947, popular vote for Sikkim to join the Indian Union failed and a special protectorate status was provided to it by Jawaharlal Nehru. In 1975 by a Referendum Sikkim became the part of India.

questions.Question: The dispute over Siachen Glacier is between
questions.solution: The dispute over Siachen Glacier is between India and Pakistan. They also fought war for this disputed territory in 1984. Siachen Glacier is the 2nd longest glacier in the world's non-polar area (76km).

questions.Question:
Which country is not a member of Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and
Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC)?
questions.solution: Pakistan is not a member of Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC). BIMSTEC was established on 6th June 1997 as international organisation involving countries of South Asia and South-East Asia. It includes Bangladesh, India, Mayanmar, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Bhutan and Nepal.

questions.Question: The Indian state of Sikkim does not share a border with which neighbouring country?
questions.solution: The Indian State of Sikkim does not share a border with Bangladesh. Indian state of Sikkim share border with only 3 countries China, Nepal and Bhutan.

questions.Question: The latitude which passes through Sikkim also passes through
questions.solution: The latitude which passes through Sikkim also passes through Rajasthan. 27 degree centigrade latitude passes through Gangtok of sikkim and Alwar in Rajasthan.

questions.Question: Palghat joins which of the following states?
questions.solution: Palghat Gap, major break in the Western Ghats mountain range, in southwestern India. Located between the Nilgiri Hills to the north and the Anaimalai Hills to the south, it is about 20 miles (32 km) wide and straddles the Kerala–Tamil Nadu border, serving as a major communication route between those two states.

questions.Question: The place Sabarimala is situatad in which of the following states?
questions.solution: Sabarimala is a Hindu pilgrimage centre located at the Periyar Tiger Reserve in the Western Ghat mountain ranges of Pathanamthitta District, Perunad grama panchayat in Kerala.

questions.Question: Which of the following Indian states does not lie on in 1do-Bangla border?
questions.solution: Manipur does not lie in 1do-Bangla border. Assam, Mizoram and Tripura lie in 1do-Bangla border.

questions.Question: Which mountain is not the part of Himalayan range?
questions.solution: Aravalli is not a part of Himalayan range. It lies in North western part of India and Gurushikhar with an height of about 1722 meters is the highest peak of Aravalli.

questions.Question: What separates Daman and Diu?
questions.solution: Daman and Diu is a union territory in western India. With an area of 112 km square it is the smallest federal division of India on the mainland. The territory comprises two distinct regions Daman and Diu, geographically separated by the Gulf of Khambhat.

questions.Question: Lakshadweep is a group of how many islands?
questions.solution: Lakshadweep is a group of 36 islands. It is a group of about 36 islands and has a total land area of 32 square kilometers which is scattered over 30,000 square miles of the Arabian Sea. Out of the 36 islands, only ten are inhabited and they are Andrott, Amini, Agatti, Bitra, Chetlat, Kadmat, Kalpeni, Kavaratti, Kiltan and Minicoy.

questions.Question: If the usual rule of calculation of time were applied for the extremes of Gujrat and Arunachal Pradesh, then approximately time ________
questions.optionA: At Gujarat would be ahead of that at Arunachal Pradesh by about 3 hours
questions.optionB: At Gujarat would be ahead of that at Arunachal Pradesh by about 2 hours
questions.optionC: At Arunachal Pradesh would be ahead of that at Gujarat by about 3 hours
questions.optionD: At Arunachal Pradesh would be ahead of that at Gujarat by about 2 hours
questions.solution: If the usual rule of calculation of time were applied for the extremes of Gujrat and Arunachal Pradesh, then approximately time at Arunachal Pradesh would be ahead of that at Gujarat by about 2 hours.

questions.Question: Between which one of the following pairs of islands is Duncan Passage located?
questions.optionB: Little Andaman and Car Nicobar Island
questions.optionC: Car Nicobar Island and Little Nicobar Island
questions.optionD: Little Nicobar Island and Great Nicobar Island
questions.solution: Duncan Passage is located between Little Andaman and Car Nicobar Island. Duncan Passage is a strait in the Indian Ocean. It is about 48 km (30 mi) wide; it separates Rutland Island (part of Great Andaman) to the north, and Little Andaman to the south.

questions.Question: With which of the following countries India has no boundary ?
questions.solution: Mongolia has no boundary with India. Mongolia is a vast and sparsely populated, landlocked country in eastern Asia between Russia to the north and China to the south, east of Kazakhstan.

questions.Question: The present demographic transition of India is indicative of ________
questions.optionA: High population growth potential but low actual growth
questions.optionB: High population growth potential and high actual growth
questions.solution: The present demographic transition of India is indicative of typically increasing urbanization. Urbanisation is the increase in the proportion of people living in towns and cities.

questions.Question: India shares its border with China along the Himalayan range. Which of the following states touches the border of China?
questions.solution: Arunachal Pradesh touches the border of China. Arunachal Pradesh borders the states of Assam and Nagaland to the south and shares international borders with Bhutan in the west, Myanmar in the east and is separated from China in the north by the McMahon Line.

questions.Question: Which of the following is not true with regard to the coastal plains of India ?
questions.optionA: The west coast has a narrow alluvial margin interspersed by hilly terrain
questions.optionB: The eastern coast has a wide plain with well-developed deltas of the major rivers
questions.optionC: The west coast has little indentation except towards the south
questions.optionD: The west and east coasts, have the same alluvial features
questions.solution: The East Coast Plain is formed by fine alluvial soil and is fertile especially on the deltas. Consequently agriculture is developed. The West Coast Plain lies along the west coast of India and is washed by the Arabian Sea.

questions.Question: The part of the Himalayas lying between Satluj and Kali rivers is known as
questions.solution: The part of the Himalayas lying between the rivers Satluj and Kali is known as Kumaon Himalayas . Kumaun Himalayas, west-central section of the Himalayas in northern India, extending 200 miles ( 320 km) from the Sutlej River east to the Kali River.

questions.Question: A rift valley is formed mainly due to ________
questions.optionA: Forces of tension in the earth's crust
questions.optionB: The subsidence of the floor of a river valley
questions.optionC: The valley formed after the formation of fold mountains
questions.optionD: The deepening of a valley by ice action
questions.solution: A rift valley is formed mainly due to the subsidence of the floor of a river valley. A rift valley is formed on a divergent plate boundary, a crustal extension or spreading apart of the surface, which is subsequently further deepened by the forces of erosion.

questions.Question: The Cuddapah Ranges lie between
questions.solution: The Cuddapah Ranges lie between Godavari and Palkonda Range. Kadapa (alternatively spelled Cuddapah) is a city in the Rayalseema region of the south-central part of Andhra Pradesh, India . It is the district headquarters of Kadapa district.

questions.Question: Baltoro glacier is located in
questions.solution: If Polar Regions are not counted, Baltoro glacier is the longest glacier (63 km). It lies in Gilgit-Balitistan region of karakoram mountain ranges.

questions.Question: Which foreign country is closest to Andaman Islands?
questions.solution: Myanmar is the nearest mainland and foreign country from Andaman. The Andaman and Nicobar Islands, one of the eight union territories of India, are a group of islands at the juncture of the Bay of Bengal and Andaman Sea.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is most prone to earthquakes?
questions.solution: Young folded mountains is most prone to earthquakes. The movement of the two plates forces sedimentary rocks upwards into a series of folds. Mostly earthquakes occur in the belt of young-fold mountains becuse young fold mountains are formed because of tectonic activities.

questions.Question: The Tropic of Cancer does not pass through ________
questions.solution: The tropic of cancer does not pass through Odisha. The tropic of cancer passes through 8 Indian states. They are Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Jharkhand, Tripura, and Mizoram.

questions.Question: Mac Mohan Line demarcates the boundary between ________
questions.solution: Mac Mohan Line demarcates the boundary between India and China. The McMahon Line is the demarcation line between the Tibetan region of China and the North-east region of India proposed by British colonial administrator Henry McMahon at the 1914 Simla Convention signed between British and Tibetan representatives.

questions.Question: India lies in the hemisphere ________
questions.solution: India is located within both the eastern hemisphere, like the rest of Asia, and the northern hemisphere. India is considered part of the South Asia region, and it is the seventh-largest country in the world by geographical size.

questions.Question: Indian sovereignity in sea extends upto ________ nautical miles.
questions.solution: Indian sovereignty in sea extends upto 12 nautical miles. Each coastal state may claim a territorial sea that extends seaward up to 12 nautical miles (nm) from its baselines. The coastal state exercises sovereignty over its territorial sea, the airspace above it, and the seabed and subsoil beneath it.

questions.Question: The highest peak of the Himalayas in India is in ________
questions.solution: Kangchenjunga – 8,586 m. The Kangchenjunga is the highest mountain peak in India and ranked 3rd highest summit in the world with an elevation of 8,586 m (28,169 ft). The highest mountain Kangchenjunga is located at the border of India and Nepal in the great Himalayas range, Sikkim.

questions.Question: Port Blair is situated in ________
questions.solution: Port Blair is the capital of the union territory of Andaman & Nicobar Islands. It is located on the east coast of the south Andaman Island.

questions.Question: In which of the following towns does the LMT (Local Meridian Time) show the greatest deviation from the IST (Indian Standard Time) ?
questions.solution: In Kohima the LMT (Local Meridian Time) show the greatest deviation from the IST (Indian Standard Time).

questions.Question:
Which of the following is the correct chronological order of the formation of the following states in India?
1. Sikkim
2. Mizoram
3. Goa
4. Arunachal Pradesh
questions.solution: The correct chronological order of the formation of the following states in India are Sikkim, Mizoram, Arunachal Pradesh and Goa.

questions.Question: In which one of the following Islands of India is an active volcano found?
questions.solution: Barren Island, a possession of India in the Andaman Sea about 135 km NE of Port Blair in the Andaman Islands, is the only historically active volcano along the N-S-trending volcanic arc extending between Sumatra and Burma (Myanmar). The 354-m-high island is the emergent summit of a volcano that rises from a depth of about 2250 m.

questions.Question: The Khasi and Jaintia Hills are located in ________.
questions.solution: The Khasi and Jaintia Hills are a mountainous region that was mainly part of Assam and Meghalaya. Meghalaya was previously part of Assam, but on 21 January 1972, the districts of Khasi, Garo and Jaintia hills became the new state of Meghalaya.

questions.Question: Which one of the following Himalayan Passes was reopened around in the middle of the year 2006 to facilitate trade between India and China?
questions.solution: Nathu La Himalayan Passes was reopened around in the middle of the year 2006 to facilitate trade between India and China.

questions.Question:
What is the correct order of occurrence of the following places as one moves from east to west?
1. Murshidabad
2. Gorakhpur
3. Bhopal
4. Bhavnagar
questions.solution: The correct order of occurrence of the following places as one moves from east to west are Murshidabad, Gorakhpur, Bhopal and then Bhavnagar.

questions.Question: Palakkad gap connects which of the following states
questions.solution: It is a pass situated in Western Ghats between Tamil Nadu and Kerala. It is also known as Palghat gap. Other famous passes of Western Ghats are Thalghat and Bhorghat.

questions.Question: "Himadri" is the term by which the ________ are known.
questions.solution: "Himadri" is the term by which the Greater Himalayas are known. Greater Himalayas or Himadri or Himagiri comprises all major mountain ranges of the Himalayas. Greater Himalayas is also known as “Mahaan Himalaya”in Hindi.

questions.Question: The Coast line of India is
questions.solution: Length of coastline of Indian mainland is 6100 km whereas the length of coastline of India including Andaman and Nicobar and Lakshadweep islands is 7500km.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the correct sequence of the age of formation-from the youngest to the oldest-of the given mountain ranges?
questions.optionA: Himalayas, Vindhyas, Western Ghats, Deccan Traps
questions.optionB: Deccan Traps, Western Ghats, Vindhyas, Himalayas
questions.optionC: Himalayas, Western Ghats, Vindhayas, Deccan Traps
questions.optionD: Vindhyas, Himalayas, Deccan Traps, Western Ghats
questions.solution: The following is the correct sequence of the age of formation-from the youngest to the oldest-of the given mountain ranges are Himalayas, Vindhyas, Western Ghats and Deccan Traps.

questions.Question: Among the Union Territories which has the highest literacy rate?
questions.solution: Among the Union Territories Lakshadweep has the highest literacy rate. Lakshadweep has the highest literacy rate of 91.85%.

questions.Question: Nepal shares a border with which other country besides India?
questions.solution: Nepal shares its boundaries with China besides India. It acts as a buffer state between India and China.

questions.Question: Name the estuary on the border of India and Pakistan?
questions.solution: Sir creek is an estuary between Gujarat state (India) and Sind province (Pakistan). The dispute between India & Pakistan is mainly because of the presence of high reserve of oil and gas.

questions.Question: Which city is served by Diamond Harbour?
questions.solution: Kolkata city is served by Diamond Harbour. Diamond Harbour is a small town of 33,000 in South 24 Parganas District of West Bengal in India. It is situated on the banks of the river Hoogly, 51km south of Calcutta. It is located at the point where the Ganges River turns south toward the Bay of Bengal.

questions.Question: The longitudes of main land of India extends between ________.
questions.solution: The mainland extends between latitudes 8° 4' and 37° 6' north, longitudes 68° 7' and 97° 25' east and measures about 3,214 km from north to south between the extreme latitudes and about 2,933 km from east to west between the extreme longitudes.

questions.Question: India is the largest country in the world
questions.solution: In terms of area India is the 7th largest country in World whereas, Russia is the largest country. On the other hand in term of population India is 2nd largest just after China.

questions.Question: Which state has the largest coastline in India?
questions.solution: From the given options Andhra Pradesh has the largest coastline with a length of about 974 km. Overall in India, Gujarat has the longest coast line.

questions.Question: Which of the following state/union territory land is situated on eastern and western coasts?
questions.solution: Pondicherry is spread over following regions. Yanam- Andhra PradeshPondicherry - Tamilnadu Karaikal - Tamilnadu Mahe - Kerala

questions.Question: Which of the following will not get direct rays of sun?
questions.solution: From the given options Srinagar lies above the Tropic of Cancer and Sun's apparent movement takes placebetween Tropic of Cancer and Tropic of Capricorn.

questions.Question: With which country, India has the longest international boundary?
questions.solution: India has the longest international boundary with Bangladesh(4096.70 km). Country Length of boundary 1. Bangladesh 4,096.70 km 2. China 3,488 km 3. Pakistan 3,323 km 4. Nepal 1,751 km 5. Myanmar 1,643 km 6. Bhutan 699 km 7. Afghanistan POK(disputed area) 106 km

questions.Question: Katchatheevu Island was ceded by India to which country in 1974?
questions.solution: Katchatheevu is a volcanic island located between India and Sri Lanka near Palk Strait. Till 1974 this island to was administered by India but the then Prime Minister of India ceded it to Sri Lanka. Presently it is under the administrative control Sri Lankan Government.

questions.Question: The Himalayas are generally divided into three ranges which do not include ________
questions.solution: The Himalayas are generally divided into three ranges which are Siwalik, Greater Himalayas and Lesser Himalayas. The Karakoram or Karakorum is a large mountain range spanning the borders of Pakistan, India, and China, with the northwest extremity of the range extending to Afghanistan and Tajikistan.

questions.Question: Bhutan is surrounded by which of the following Indian States?
questions.optionA: Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim
questions.optionC: Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, West Bengal, Bihar
questions.solution: Bhutan is surrounded by Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal and Sikkim. Bhutan is located on the southern slopes of the eastern Himalayas, landlocked between the Tibet autonomous region to the north and the Indian states of Sikkim, West Bengal, Assam, and Arunachal Pradesh to the west and south.

questions.Question: Which of the following tribes is not found in Central India ?
questions.solution: Todas tribes is not found in Central India. Toda Tribe is the most ancient and unusual tribe of Nilgiri Hills of Tamil nadu. The todas have their own language.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the junction point of the Eastern Ghats and Western Ghats?
questions.solution: Nilgiri Hills is the junction point of the Eastern Ghats and Western Ghats. The Eastern Ghats are a discontinuous range of mountains along India's eastern coast whereas Western Ghats also known as Sahyadri is a mountain range that runs parallel to the western coast of the Indian peninsula. Eastern ghats and Western ghats meet at the Nilgiri hills in Tamil Nadu.

questions.Question:
1. Assam shares a border with Bhutan and Bangladesh.
2. West Bengal shares a border with Bhutan and Nepal.
3. Mizoram shares a border with Bangladesh and Myanmar.
Which of the statements given above are correct?
questions.solution: All the statements given above are correct. Assam shares a border with Bhutan and Bangladesh, West Bengal shares a border with Bhutan and Nepal and Mizoram shares a border with Bangladesh and Myanmar.

questions.Question: Madhya Pradesh shares its border with how many States?
questions.solution: Madhya Pradesh shares its border with 5 states namely Uttar Pradesh to the northeast, Chhattisgarh to the southeast, Maharashtra to the south, Gujarat to the west, and Rajasthan to the northwest.

questions.Question: Which of the following latitudes passes through India?
questions.solution: Tropic of Cancer latitudes passes through India. The Tropic of Cancer divides India into almost two equal parts by passing through 8 states, namely- Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Tripura & Mizoram. South of 22° north latitude, the country tapers off over 800 km into the Indian Ocean as a peninsula.

questions.Question: The Eastern Coast of India is known as ________
questions.solution: The Eastern Coast of India is known as Coromandal Coast. Coromandel Coast, broad coastal plain in eastern Tamil Nadu state, southern India. Extending over an area of about 8,800 square miles (22,800 square km), it is bounded by the Utkal Plains to the north, the Bay of Bengal to the east, the Kaveri delta to the south, and the Eastern Ghats to the west.

questions.Question: Which of the following is the highest peak in undisputed Indian territory
questions.solution: Kanchenjunga is the highest peak in undisputed Indian territory. Although highest peak in India is K2 i.e. Godwin Austin but it lies in the disputed POK region. After K2 it is Kanchenjunga with an elevation of about 8598m which is the highest peak in India.

questions.Question: Diu is an Island
questions.solution: Diu is an island besides Gujarat. Diu Island is an island off the southern coast of Gujarat's Kathiawar peninsula, separated from the mainland by a tidal creek. It has an area of 40 km², and a population of 44,110. It belongs to Diu district and lies 5 km to the east of Diu head. Diu is part of the union territory of Daman and Diu.

questions.Question: In the Andaman Islands live the
questions.solution: In the Andaman Islands lives the Onge. The Onge call themselves En-iregale, which means 'perfect person.' They have long lived on Little Andaman Island, the most southerly island in the Andaman archipelago.

questions.Question: Where is Saddle Peak in Andaman and Nicobar Island situated?
questions.solution: Surrounded by Saddle Peak National Park at an height of about 732 m, Saddle Peak is located on North Andaman Island.

questions.Question: The latitudes of main land of India extends between
questions.solution: The latitudes of main land of India extends between 8°4' N and 37°6' N. Lying entirely in the Northern Hemisphere, the Country extends between 8° 4' and 37° 6' latitudes north of the Equator, and 68° 7' and 97° 25' longitudes east of it.

questions.Question: What is the name of India's Southern Tip?
questions.solution: Indira Point is the name of India's Southern Tip. Indira Point is a village in the Nicobar district at Great Nicobar Island of Andaman and Nicobar Islands in India. It is located in the Great Nicobar tehsil. It is the location of the southernmost point of India's territory.

questions.Question: Sun Temple is situated in the state of
questions.solution: Sun temple is at Konark in Odisha. It is also called "Black Pagoda' and it is listed in UNESCO World Heritage Site.

questions.Question:
Kullu valley is located among which of the following
mountain ranges?
questions.solution: Kullu valley is located among Dhauladhar and Pir Panjal. Kullu Valley is a broad open valley in Himachal Pradesh, India, formed by the Beas River between Manali and Largi.

questions.Question: The smallest Union Territory is ________
questions.solution: The smallest Union Territory is Lakshadweep. India's smallest Union Territory Lakshadweep is an archipelago consisting of 36 islands with an area of 32 sq km.

questions.Question: The 'Mahe region' located on the western coast of India is politically a part of the Union Territory of ________
questions.solution: The 'Mahe region' located on the western coast of India is politically a part of the Union Territory of Pondicherry. Mahe is situated on the Malabar coast on the Western Ghats surrounded by Kerala.

questions.Question: Which one of the following countries has the longest international boundary with India?
questions.solution: Bangladesh has the longest international boundary with India. Bangladesh and India share a 4,096-kilometer (2,545-mile) long international border, the fifth-longest land border in the world. West Bengal with 2,217 km share longest border with Bangladesh.

questions.Question: Among the following Union Territories of India, which one has the largest size?
questions.solution: Pondicherry has the largest size and has four administrative divisions: four districts, viz. Pondicherry , Mahé, Yanam and Karaikal. Pondicherry district has the largest area and population.

questions.Question: Which is the highest peak in India?
questions.solution: K2 is highest peak in India with an height of about 8611 meters. It is the Karakoram range.

questions.Question: Which state has the largest area in India?
questions.solution: Rajasthan is a state in northern India. The state covers an area of 342,239 square kilometres. It is the largest Indian state by area and the seventh largest by population.

questions.Question: The mountain range which stretches from Gujarat in west to Delhi in the north is the ________
questions.solution: The mountain range which stretches from Gujarat in the west to Delhi in the north is the Aravallis.

questions.Question: Which one of the following mountains is not the part of Eastern Ghats?
questions.solution: Elamalai hills is not the part of Eastern Ghats. Elumalaiis a Panchayat town in the district of Madurai, in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. Originally named Aezhumalai (Seven Hills), the town is located near Usilampatti (16 km) and Peraiyur, in the Western ghats.

questions.Question: Where is the Saltoro Range located?
questions.solution: Saltoro ranges are located in Karakoram ranges. It lies in Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir. Saltoro glacier is also situated here.

questions.Question: What is the name of the disputed coastal area located far from Gujarat coast in between India and Pakistan?
questions.solution: Sir Creek is the disputed territory forming a tidal estuary of 96 km between India and Pakistan. It lies in Rann of Kuchh.

questions.Question:
Which of the following are included in the World-Heritage List of UNESCO? :
1. Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park
2. Chhatrapati Shivaji Railway Station, Mumbai
3. Mamallapuram
4. Sun Temple (Konark Temple)
questions.solution: The following are included in the World-Heritage List of UNESCO are Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park, Chhatrapati Shivaji Railway Station, Mumbai, Mamallapuram and Sun Temple (Konark Temple).

questions.Question: Which of the following is the largest union territory of India?
questions.solution: Andaman & Nicobar Islands is a group of 572 islands / islets and the largest union territory in India with an area of 8,249 sq km. They are situated between 6o and 14o North Latitude and 92o and 94o East Longitude.

questions.Question: Andaman and Nicobar Islands are separated by which of the following?
questions.solution: Andaman and Nicobar Islands are separated by Ten degree channel. The Ten Degree Channel is a channel that separates the Andaman Islands and Nicobar Islands from each other in the Bay of Bengal. The two sets of islands together form the Indian Union Territory (UT) of Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

questions.Question: Out of the four southern States: Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu.which shares boundaries with the maximum number of Indian States?
questions.optionC: Each of Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka
questions.optionD: Each of Tamil Nadu and Kerala
questions.solution: Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka in southern shares boundaries with the maximum number of Indian States.

questions.Question: Through which one of the following Indian states the Tropic of Cancer does not pass?
questions.solution: Tropic of cancer does not pass through Manipur. The tropic of cancer passes through 8 Indian states. They are Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, West Bengal, Jharkhand, Tripura, and Mizoram.

questions.Question: 28.38 N. and 77.12 E are the respective latitude and longitude of which one of the following places?
questions.solution: The latitude of New Delhi, Delhi, India is 28.644800, and the longitude is 77.216721. New Delhi, Delhi, India is located at India country in the Cities place category with the gps coordinates of 28° 38' 41.2800'' N and 77° 13' 0.1956'' E.

questions.Question: The hill station of Coonoor is located in which one of the following states?
questions.solution: Coonoor is a Taluk and a municipality of the Nilgiris district in the Indian State of Tamil Nadu.

questions.Question: Kanchipuram is in which of the following states?
questions.solution: Kanchipuram, also known as Kanchi, is an ancient city in southern India’s Tamil Nadu state. Considered a holy pilgrimage site by Hindus, it is home to many temples. The 8th-century Kailasanathar Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is a vast complex with intricate sandstone carvings.

questions.Question: The approximate age of the Aravallis range is
questions.solution: The Aravallis range are the oldest mountain in India. The approximate age of the Aravillis range is 670 million years.

questions.Question: Port Blair - the capital of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, is located in which one of the following islands?
questions.solution: Port Blair is the capital of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, is located in South Andaman. They belongs to the South Andaman administrative district, part of the Indian union territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

questions.Question: Which of the following organisations prepares topographical maps of India?
questions.solution: Geographical Survey of India organisations prepares topographical maps of India. The Map showing topographic regions - the Himalayas, The Peninsular Plateau, The Northern Plains, and the Coastal Plains, etc. India is home to various geographical features such as rivers, mountains, valleys, tablelands, seashores, deserts, and flat terrains. The country is a traveler's paradise.

questions.Question: The Himalayas are formed of parallel fold ranges of which the oldest range is ________
questions.solution: The Himalayas are formed of parallel fold ranges of which the oldest range is The Great Himalayan Range. The Great Himalayas are situated to the north of the Lower Himalayan Mountain Range. These mountains are bordered by the Indus River to the west and north. Subsequently, the river takes a southerly bend at Sazin.

questions.Question: The Union Territory of Dadra and Nagar Haveli lies between which of the following states of India?
questions.solution: Dadra and Nagar Haveli, union territory of India, located in the western part of the country and situated between the states of Gujarat to the north and Maharashtra to the south. It lies some 15 miles (24 km) from the Arabian Sea and about 80 miles (130 km) north of Mumbai (Bombay).

questions.Question: The percentage of literates in India is ________
questions.optionA: Almost equal among males and females
questions.optionD: Lower in urban areas than in rural areas
questions.solution: The percentage of literates in India is higher among males than females. The major reasons for higher literacy rate among the males than that among female are: Tradition: In Indian tradition education among males is encouraged. Women are generally kept confined in domestic sphere. However, this situation has been changing now.

questions.Question: The first range of Himalayas to the North of Ganga Plains is the
questions.solution: The first range of Himalayas to the North of Ganga Plains is the Shiwaliks. The Shivalik Hills is a mountain range of the outer Himalayas. The hills consist of 6000 meters of layered rocks. They are known as the sub-Himalayas or the foothills and were formed by the erosion caused by the rise of the Himalayas.

questions.Question: The area of India is ________ times larger than the area of Pakistan
questions.solution: Pakistan has an area about 796, 095 sq.km. whereas area of India is 3,287,263 sq.km. which is roughly 4 times larger.

questions.Question: The highest peak in India
questions.solution: K2 also known as Godwin Austin is the highest peak in India. Its elevation is about 8611m. Apart from being world's second highest mountain it is also known as "Savag mountain" due to extreme weather.

questions.Question: Which one of the following longitudes determines the Indian Standard Time?
questions.solution: 82.5ºE longitudes determines the Indian Standard Time. The 82½o east longitude is considered as the standard meridian of India.The local time along this longitude is generally considered as the common time of India.This is known as Indian Standard Time. Indian Standard Time is 5.5 hours (5 hours 30 minutes) ahead of Greenwich Mean Time(GMT+5.5).

questions.Question: Which of the following is the highest peak
questions.solution: Nangaparbat is the highest peak. It is the ninth highest peak in the world, at 26,660 feet (8,130 m) high. In 1953, an Austrian German named Hermann Buhl was the first to climb it.

questions.Question: The piligrims of Kailash Mansarovar have to pass through which pass to enter into Tibet?
questions.solution: Lipu lekh pass in Uttarkhand is the way through which pilgrims of Kailash Mansarovar enters Tibet.

questions.Question: The group of languages spoken by the largest number of people in India is ________
questions.solution: The group of languages spoken by the largest number of people in India is Indo-Aryan. It is part of the Indo-European family of languages, which came to India with the Aryans. It is the biggest of the language groups in India and accounts for about 74% of the total Indian population.

questions.Question: What is the other name of Sahyadri Range?
questions.solution: Sahyadri range (Western Ghats) are mountain escarpments formed due to collapse of western side of India plateau during the formation of Himalayan mountain system.

questions.Question: The State with the largest area under waste land is ________
questions.solution: The state with the largest area under waste land is Rajasthan.

questions.Question: Which of the following would have to be crossed to reach Sri Lanka from Nagercoil ?
questions.solution: Gulf of Mannar have to be crossed to reach Sri Lanka from Nagercoil. Nagar Kovil or Nagerkovil or Nakarkovil or Nagarcoil is a small town in Jaffna District, Sri Lanka.

questions.Question:
Which of the statements given are correct?
1. Korba is west to Rourkela.
2. Rourkela is south to Ranchi.
questions.solution: Both the statements given are correct. Korba is west to Rourkela. Korba is located at22.35°N 82.68°E. It has an average elevation of 252 metres (826 feet). As of 2011 India census, Korba city had a population of 365,253. Rourkela is south to Ranchi. Rourkela is located at 84.54E longitude and 22.12N latitude in Sundergarh district of Odisha at an elevation of about 219 m (719 ft) above mean sea level. The area of Rourkela is 200 square kilometres

questions.Question: Which of the following relates to the formation of the Himalayas?
questions.solution: Folding of the geosyncline relates to the formation of the Himalayas. The geosynclinal sediments of Tethys sea were squeezed and folded into Alpine-Himalayan mountain chains due to lateral compressive forces caused by the convergence and collision of Eurasian and African-Indian continental plates during Cenozoic Era.

questions.Question: Which is the eastern most peak of Himalaya?
questions.solution: The eastern most peak of Himalaya is Namcha Barwa from where Brahmaputra river enters India. The westernmost peak is Nangaparbat.

questions.Question: The climate of India is mainly tropical because ________
questions.optionA: Of the location of the Himalayas in its North
questions.optionB: Major part of India lies within the tropics
questions.optionC: Of the overpowering influence of India Ocean
questions.optionD: Of the seasonal influence of jet streams
questions.solution: The climate of India is mainly tropical because of the location of the Himalayas in its North. India is home to an extraordinary variety of climatic regions, ranging from tropical in the south to temperate and alpine in the Himalayan north, where elevated regions receive sustained winter snowfall. The nation's climate is strongly influenced by the Himalayas and the Thar Desert.

questions.Question: The longitudinal valley lying between Lesser Himalaya and the ________ are known as Duns.
questions.solution: The Longitudinal valleys that lie between Lesser Himalayas and Outer Himalayas (Shivaliks) are known as Duns. Dehradun is an example such valley.

questions.Question: The Tropic of Cancer which passes through India is ________ to/of the equator.
questions.solution: The Tropic of Cancer which passes through India is to the North of the equator. The Tropic of Cancer, also referred to as the Northern Tropic is 23°26′13.5″ (or 23.43708°) north of the Equator. It is the most northerly circle of latitude on the Earth at which the Sun can be directly overhead.

questions.Question:
Arrange the following places from north to south of Kashmir region :
1. Srinagar
2. Gilgit
3. Kargil
4. Banihal
questions.solution: Following places from north to south are Gilgit, Kargil, Srinagar and Banihal

questions.Question:
Arrange the following Himalayan peaks in order as they occur from west to east:
I. Kanchenjunga
II. Mt. Everest
III. Nanda Devi
IV. Dhaulagiri
questions.solution: The Himalayan peaks in order as they occur from west to east are Nanda Devi, Dhaulagiri, Mt. Everest and Kanchenjunga.

questions.Question: The southernmost point of India is located in ________
questions.solution: The southernmost point of India is located in Great Nicobar. Indira Point is the name of the southernmost point of Republic of India. It is situated on Great Nicobar Island in the Nicobar Islands, which are located in the eastern Indian Ocean at 6°45'10″N and 93°49'36″E. This is not on the Indian mainland, but within the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

questions.Question: Nandadevi peak is located in ________ State
questions.solution: Situated in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand, Nanda Devi is the highest mountain entirely in India, (if we exclude Kanchenjunga that lies on the border of India and Nepal). It is also the highest mountain in the State of Uttarakhand with a towering altitude of 7,816 meters.

questions.Question: Which one of the following states does not form border with Bangladesh?
questions.solution: Manipur does not form border with Bangladesh. Bangladesh and India share a 4,156 km (2,582 mi)-long international border, the fifth-longest land border in the world, including 262 km (163 mi) in Assam, 856 km (532 mi) in Tripura, 180 km (110 mi) in Mizoram, 443 km (275 mi) in Meghalaya, and 2,217 km (1,378 mi) in West Bengal.

questions.Question:
Consider the following:
1. Mahadeo Hills
2. Sahyadri Parvat
3. Satpura Range
What is the correct sequence of the above from the north of the south?
questions.solution: The correct sequence of the above from the north of the south are Mahadeo Hills, Satpura Range and Sahyadri Parvat.

questions.Question: Amritsar and Shimla are almost on the same latitude, but their climate difference is due to
questions.solution: Amritsar and Shimla are almost on the same latitude, but their climate difference is due to the difference in their altitudes.

questions.Question: Which one of the following groups of Indian states has a common frontier with Bhutan?
questions.optionA: Assam, Bihar, Sikkim and West Bengal
questions.optionB: Bihar, Meghalaya, Sikkim and West Bengal
questions.optionC: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Sikkim and West Bengal
questions.optionD: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Sikkim and West Bengal
questions.solution: Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Sikkim and West Bengal groups of Indian states has a common frontier with Bhutan.

questions.Question:
The Tropic of Cancer passes through the States of:
1. Gujarat
2. Jharkhand
3. Assam
4. Mizoram
questions.solution: The Tropic of Cancer passes through the States of Gujarat, Jharkhand and Mizoram.

questions.Question: Which one of the following sequences in the ascending order of their geographical size is correct?
questions.optionB: Jharkhand - West Bengal - Tamil Nadu - Chattisgarh
questions.optionC: West Bengal - Bihar - Chhattisgarh - Tamil Nadu
questions.solution: The following sequences in the ascending order of their geographical size is Jharkhand, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu and Chattisgarh

questions.Question: Which one of the following groups comprises of States sharing borders with Chhattisgarh ?
questions.optionA: Andhra Pradesh, Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Orissa
questions.optionB: Andhra Pradesh, Bihar, Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh
questions.optionD: Andhra Pradesh, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal
questions.solution: The following groups comprises of States sharing borders with Chhattisgarh are Andhra Pradesh, Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Orissa.

questions.Question: Where exactly is Aksai Chin?
questions.optionB: The north-east corner of Jammu and Kashmir
questions.solution: Aksai Chin is in the north-east corner of Jammu and Kashmir. Aksai Chin is one of the two large disputed border areas between India and China. India claims Aksai Chin as the easternmost part of the Jammu and Kashmir state.

questions.Question: The Konkan Coast stretches between ________
questions.solution: The Konkan Coast stretches between Goa and Daman. Konkan, also called Aparanta, coastal plain of western India, lying between the Arabian Sea (west) and the Western Ghats (east).

questions.Question: Where is Lakshadweep Island located?
questions.solution: Lakshadweep Island is located in Arabian sea. It has an area of only 32 sqkm. It is a Coral island which is sarated from Maldives by 8 degree channel.

questions.Question: Which one of the following Indian states does not have a common international border with Bangladesh?
questions.solution: Manipur does not have a common international border with Bangladesh. India enjoys close relations with Bangladesh and shares a 4,096-km-long border which touches Assam, Tripura, Mizoram, Meghalaya and West Bengal.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is a famous hill station of South India?
questions.solution: Ootacamund is a famous hill station of south India. Ootacamund, now frequently known as Ooty (but officially called Udhagamandalam), is a town in the Nilgiri Hills.

questions.Question: Which hill station's name means 'place of the thunderbolt'?
questions.solution: Darjeeling is derived from the word 'Dorje' meaning 'thunderbolt' & 'ling' meaning 'place or land'. Both 'Dorje' & 'ling' are Tibetan words.

questions.Question: The outer most range of Himalayas is called ________.
questions.solution: The Outer Himalayas (the Siwalik Range) The southernmost of the three mountain belts are the Outer Himalayas, also called the Siwalik (or Shiwalik).

questions.Question: The Himalayan mountain system belongs to which one of the following?
questions.solution: The Himalayan mountain system belongs to fold mountain system. Fold mountains are created where two of Earth’s tectonic plates are pushed together.

questions.Question: Which of the following passes lies in the Sutlej valley?
questions.solution: Sultej river originates from Rakas Lake near Mansarovar lake and enters Indian state of Himachal Pradesh through Shipki La Pass.

questions.Question: Which one of the following mountain peaks of Himalayas is not in India?
questions.solution: Annapurna mountain peaks of Himalayas is not in India. Annapurna is the mountain range which is not present in India and it is present in Nepal.

questions.Question: Amongst the following Indian States which one has the minimum total forest cover?
questions.solution: Amongst the following Indian States Haryana has the minimum total forest cover. Haryana has 1588 sq km forest cover that is 3.59% of its total land area. Haryana has the least forest cover in India.

questions.Question: The new alluvial deposits found in the Gangetic plain are known as ________
questions.solution: The new alluvial deposits found in the Gangetic plain are known as Khadar. In the Gangetic plains, it has a low upland covered by laterite deposits. The Khadar belt lies in lowland areas after the Bangar belt. It is made up of fresh newer alluvium which is deposited by the rivers flowing down the plain.

questions.Question: Where do the Western and Eastern Ghats meet?
questions.solution: Western and Eastern Ghats meet at Nilgiri hills, which is situated at the boundary of three states i.e. Tamil Nadu, Kerala & Karnataka.

questions.Question:
Which of the following are true with respect to the Indian Peninsular Plateau?
I. The southern plateau block is formed mainly of granites and gneiss
II. The Deccan lava plateau is an elevated tableland consisting of horizontally arranged lava sheets
III. The Malwa plateau dominates the Vindhyan scarps forming the northern flank of the plateau
IV. The troughs of the Narmada and the Tapti are interposed between the Vindhyan and the Satpura ranges.
questions.solution: The following that are true with respect to the Indian Peninsular Plateau are The southern plateau block is formed mainly of granites and gneiss. The Deccan lava plateau is an elevated tableland consisting of horizontally arranged lava sheets. The Malwa plateau dominates the Vindhyan scarps forming the northern flank of the plateau. The troughs of the Narmada and the Tapti are interposed between the Vindhyan and the Satpura ranges.

questions.Question: In which one of the following is the Himalayan pass Shipki La located?
questions.solution: In Sutlej valley the Himalayan pass Shipki La is located. A spur road on the Indian side rises to an altitude of 4,720 metres (15,490 ft) four km southwest of Shipki La. It is located in Kinnaur district in the state of Himachal Pradesh, India, and Ngari Prefecture in Tibet, China.

questions.Question: The transport route connecting Kashmir from Leh crosses the high mountain ranges at the ________
questions.solution: The transport route connecting Kashmir from Leh crosses the high mountain ranges at the Karakoram pass.

questions.Question: The two volcanic islands in the Indian territory are ________
questions.solution: The two volcanic islands in the Indian territory are Narcondam and Barren. Narcondam is a small volcanic island located in the Andaman Sea. The island's peak rises to 710 m above mean sea level, and it is formed of andesite. It is part of the Andaman Islands, the main body of which lie approximately 124 km (77 mi) to the west. Barren Island is an island located in the Andaman Sea, dominated by Barren Volcano, the only confirmed active volcano in South Asia, and the only active volcano along a chain of volcanoes from Sumatra to Myanmar.

questions.Question: The highest Himalayan peak in India is ________
questions.solution: The Kangchenjunga is the highest mountain peak in India and ranked 3rd highest summit in the world with an elevation of 8,586 m (28,169 ft). The highest mountain Kangchenjunga is located at the border of India and Nepal in the great Himalayas range,Sikkim.

questions.Question: The Garo, Khasi and Jaintia hills were formed in the same age as the
questions.solution: The Garo, Khasi and Jaintia hills were formed in the same age as the Malwa Plateau. The Garo, Khasi and jaintia are part of the Peninsular India. The Peninsular plateau continues far eastward from Rajmahal hills into north-east as the Shillong plateau, the gap between them is known as the Rajmahal-Garo gap.

questions.Question: Nathu La a place where India China border trade has been resumed after 44 years is located on the India border in
questions.solution: Nathu La a place where India China border trade has been resumed after 44 years is located on the India border in Sikkim. For trading between India and China there are trading border posts of which Nathu la pass in Sikkim is one. The other two pass are Shipkila in H.P. and Lipulekh in Uttarakhand. After 1962 Sino-India war, Nathula was closed but from 2006 it has been reopened for restricted trade.

questions.Question: The range that acts as watershed between India and Turkistan is
questions.solution: Karakoram forms India's frontiers with Afghanistan and China and acts as watershed between India and Turkistan.

questions.Question: Considering the location of mountains in India which one of the following is in right sequence from south to north?
questions.solution: Considering the location of mountains in India, the right sequence from south to north are Dodabetta, Vindhyachal, Dhaulagiri and Kailash.

questions.Question: The oldest inhabitants of India are considered to be ________
questions.solution: The oldest inhabitants of India are considered to be Negritoes. Perhaps they were the first of the racial groups that came to India. They got settled in the hilly areas of Kerala and the Andaman Islands. Kadar, Irula and Puliyan tribes of Kerala resemble to a great extent with the Negritos. They are related to Africa, Australia and their neighbouring islands. The Negritos have black (dark) skin, woolly hair, broad and flat nose and slightly protruded jaws.

questions.Question: Why is it that the Himalayan region is poor in mineral resources?
questions.optionA: Displacement of rock strata has disturbed the arrangement of rocks and made it complex
questions.optionB: It is made up of crystalline rock
questions.optionC: The terrain makes exploitation of minerals difficult
questions.optionD: The climatic conditions are not suitable, for exploitation of minerals
questions.solution: Himalayan region is poor in mineral resources because displacement of rock strata has disturbed the arrangement of rocks and made it complex.

questions.Question: Which of the following States of India do not lie entirely in the Tropical Zone of the Earth?
questions.solution: Gujarat do not lie entirely in the Tropical Zone of the Earth. The tropics are the region of the Earth near to the equator and between the Tropic of Cancer in the northern hemisphere and the Tropic of Capricorn in the southern hemisphere. This region is also referred to as the tropical zone and the torrid zone.

questions.Question: How many States and Union Territories are there in India?
questions.optionB: 28 States and 9 Union territories (including National capital territory-1)
questions.solution: There are 29 states and seven Union territories in the country.
