questions.Question: Among the following States of India, which one has the oldest rock formations in the country?
questions.solution: Karnataka has the oldest rock formations in the country. Dharwad is the district headquarters of Dharwad district in the state of Karnataka, India. It was merged with the city of Hubballi in 1961 to form the twin cities of Hubballi-Dharwad. It covers an area of 200.23 km² and is located 425 km northwest of Bengaluru, on NH-48, between Bengaluru and Pune. The oldest rocks in India are reported from Dharwar region, Karnataka.

questions.Question: ________ is a cold desert lying in the Great Himalayas.
questions.solution: Ladakh is a cold desert lying in the Great Himalayas. It lies in the Great Himalayas, on the eastern side of Jammu and Kashmir. It has the mighty Karakoram Range in the North and in the south, it is bound by the Zanskar mountains.

questions.Question: Which one of the following statements is wrong regarding the "Vale of Kashmir" ?
questions.optionB: It is situated 'between the Pir Panjal Range and the Lesser Himalayas
questions.optionC: It is drained by the river Jhelum
questions.optionD: Previously it was a bed of a great lake, subsequently uplifted.
questions.solution: The Kashmir Valley, also known as the Vale of Kashmir, is an intermontane valley in the portion of the Kashmir region administered by India. The valley is bounded on the southwest by the Pir Panjal Range and on the northeast by the main Himalayas range.

questions.Question: Naga, Khasi and Garo hills are located in
questions.solution: Naga, Khasi and Garo hills al are located in North eastern India. Karakoram, Zanskar and Himalayan range are in North western part of India.

questions.Question: Godwin Austin is a
questions.solution: Godwin Austin is the 2nd highest peak in world after Mount Everest. It is also called K2. Its height is about 8611 meters.

questions.Question:
The States which have common borders with China are:
1. Jammu and Kashmir
2. Sikkim
3. Arunachal Pradesh
4. Himachal Pradesh
questions.solution: The States which have common borders with China are Jammu and Kashmir, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh and Himachal Pradesh.

questions.Question: Which state does not share a common border with Chhattisgarh?
questions.solution: Andhra Pradesh does not share a common border with Chhattisgarh. The border of Chattisgarh is shared by Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, Odisha, Telangana, Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh.

questions.Question: The border of Union Territory of Puducherry does not meet with
questions.solution: The border of Union Territory of Puducherry does not meet with Karnataka. Puducherry is spread over 3 states:- Yanam - Andhra Pradesh, Puducherry & Karaikal - Tamil Nadu and Mahe - Kerala.

questions.Question: Which district of Himachal Pradesh touches the border of China?
questions.solution: Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh touches the border of China. Chitkul (Chittkul) is a village in Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh. It is the last inhabited village near the Indo-China border. The Indian road ends here.

questions.Question: The EEZ (Exclusive Economic Zone) of India is
questions.solution: The EEZ (Exclusive Economic Zone) of India is 360 km. Exclusive Economic Zone is an area beyond to the territorial sea. Extending seaward to 200 nmi (360 km) out from its coastline.

questions.Question: The Standard Meridian of India is
questions.solution: The Standard Meridian of India is 82.5 E longitude. The 82˚5' E longitude is taken as the Standard Time Meridian of India or reference letters longitude for IST, as it passes through the middle of India (from Mirzapur, near Allahabad).

questions.Question: Saddle peak the highest peak of Andaman and Nicobar Islands is located in
questions.solution: Saddle peak is the highest peak in Bay of Bengal's Andaman and Nicobar archipelago. Its elevation is about 732m and it lies in North Andaman.

questions.Question:
Identify from the following states of India through which the Tropic of Cancer passes and arrange them from east to west:
1. Gujarat
2. West Bengal
3. Uttar Pradesh
4. Jharkhand
5. Madhya Pradesh
6. Bihar
7. Chhattisgarh
questions.solution: The following states of India that through the Tropic of Cancer passes east to west direction are West Bengal, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat.

questions.Question:
Which of the following gives the correct match of states and concentration of religious groups?
1. Maharashtra- Zaroastrians
2. Maharashtra and Arunachal Pradesh - Buddhists
3. Rajasthan and Gujarat - Jains
4. Sikkim - Christians
questions.solution: The following that gives the correct match of states and concentration of religious groups are Maharashtra- Zaroastrians, Maharashtra and Arunachal Pradesh - Buddhists and Rajasthan and Gujarat - Jains.

questions.Question: The oldest mountains in India according to geographical history are ________
questions.solution: The oldest mountains in India according to geographical history are Aravallis. The Aravalli Range, an eroded stub of ancient mountains, is the oldest range of fold mountains in India. The natural history of the Aravalli Range dates back to times when the Indian Plate was separated from the Eurasian Plate by an ocean.

questions.Question: In our country, the Tropic of Cancer passes through the
questions.solution: In our country, the Tropic of Cancer passes through the Central part. The Tropic of Cancer divides India into almost two equal parts by passing through 8 states, namely- Gujarat, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Tripura & Mizoram. South of 22° north latitude, the country tapers off over 800 km into the Indian Ocean as a peninsula.

questions.Question: Nallamala hills are located in the state of
questions.solution: Nallamalla hills area part of Eastern Ghats which are spread over two states i.e. Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. These ranges runs from north to south parallel to Coromandel coast.

questions.Question: In which one of the following Union Territories, people of the Onge tribe live?
questions.solution: In Andaman and Nicobar Islands Union Territories, people of the Onge tribe live. The Onge are one of the Andamanese indigenous peoples of the Andaman Islands. Traditionally hunter-gatherers, they are a designated as a Scheduled Tribe of India.

questions.Question: Where are Shevaroy Hills located?
questions.solution: Shevaroy Hills are located in Tamil Nadu. The Servarayan hills, with the anglicised name Shevaroy Hills, are a towering mountain range near the city of Salem, in Tamil Nadu state, southern India. It is one of the major hill stations in Tamil Nadu and in the Eastern Ghats. The local Tamil name comes from a local deity, Servarayan.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements:
1. Longitude of Jabalpur's location is between those of Indore and Bhopal.
2. Latitude of Aurangabad's location is between those of Vadodara and Pune.
3. Bangalore is situated more southward than Chennai.
questions.solution: Latitude of Aurangabad's location is between those of Vadodara and Pune and Bangalore is situated more southward than Chennai.

questions.Question: Which of the following cities lies to the western-most longitude?
questions.solution: Jaipur lies to the western-most longitude. Longitude: 75.8059809.

questions.Question: The latitudes that pass through Sikkim also pass through
questions.solution: The latitude that pass through Sikkim also pass through Rajasthan. 27 degree latitude passes through Gangtok of Sikkim and Alwar in Rajasthan.

questions.Question: The highest peak in South India is ________
questions.solution: Anamudi Peak -2,695 metres (8,842 ft) -Kerala. Anamudi is the highest mountain peak in the Western Ghats and also the highest point in South India, located in the southern region of Eravikulam National Park.

questions.Question: What is the name of the highest summit of Nilgiri Hills?
questions.solution: Doda Betta, mountain peak, the highest point in Tamil Nadu state, southeastern India, near Udhagamandalam. Rising to an elevation of 8,652 feet (2,637 metres), Doda Betta is a grass-covered hill that is frequently climbed by summer visitors, and the summit is accessible by automobile.

questions.Question: Which of the following gives the correct sequence of hills in the east-west direction?
questions.solution: The following that gives the correct sequence of hills in the east-west direction are Naga, Mikir, Khasi and Garo.

questions.Question: Among the following States, which one has the largest forest area?
questions.solution: Gujarat has the largest forest area. South Gujarat has far more dense forests than open forests. The Dangs recorded the highest forest cover of about 1,368 sq. km.

questions.Question: Zozila Pass connects ________
questions.solution: Zojila Pass connects Leh and Srinagar. Zoji La is a high mountain pass in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir, located on National Highway 1 between Srinagar and Leh in the western section of the Himalayan mountain range.

questions.Question: Why has the Green Revolution benefitted only a small section of India?
questions.solution: The Green Revolution had benefitted only a small section of India because large dependence on manual labour, poor storage facilities and poor farm management and administration.

questions.Question:
Arrange the following hill ranges in order from north to south:
I. Nallamala Hills
II. Nilgiri
III. Anaimalai
IV. Cardamon Hills
questions.solution: The following hill ranges in order from north to south are Nallamala Hills, Nilgiri, Anaimalai and Cardamon Hills.

questions.Question: The highest mountain peak of peninsular India is
questions.solution: Anaimudi peak lies in Anamalai hills near Palghat gap. With an height of about 2695 m it is the highest mountain peak of peninsular India.

questions.Question: The Eastern Coastal Plain is also named as
questions.solution: The Eastern Coastal Plain is also named as Coromandel coastal plains. These plains lie between Eastern Ghats and Bay of Bengal. In ancient times Chola dynasty ruled over this region and the land was called Cholamandalam from where these plains derived the name Coromandel.

questions.Question: Aravalli ranges are an example of ________
questions.solution: Aravalli ranges are an example of Residual mountains. Residual mountains are those mountains which have been eroded by the agents of degradation such as winds, rain, frost and running water. The hard rocks that are left behind are called residual mountains.

questions.Question: Jharkhand does not share boundary with ________
questions.solution: Jharkhand does not share boundary with Madhya Pradesh. Jharkhand shares its border with the states of Bihar to the north, Uttar Pradesh and Chhattisgarh to the west, Odisha to the south, and West Bengal to the east.

questions.Question: Which one of the following gives the correct sequence of Himalayan peaks in the direction east to west?
questions.optionD: Namcha Barwa, Kanchenjunga, Mt. Everest, Nanda Devi
questions.solution: The following that gives the correct sequence of Himalayan peaks in the direction east to west are Namcha Barwa, Kanchenjunga, Mt. Everest, Nanda Devi.

questions.Question: The Northern plain of India has been formed by the interplay of the three major river systems, namely the Indus, the Ganga and the ________.
questions.solution: The Northern plains of India are young depositional landforms. These are formed by interplay of Indus, Ganga, Brahmaputra and various other small rivers.

questions.Question: Which state has smallest land area?
questions.solution: Goa is the smallest state with land area of 3,702 sq km of land.

questions.Question: A pass in Himachal Pradesh is
questions.solution: Shipkila pass in Himachal Pradesh is a border post on India China border. The penetration of Sutlej river into India takes place through this pass.

questions.Question: Which of the following mountain passes lies outside India ?
questions.solution: Khyber passes lies outside India, most northerly and important of the passes between Afghanistan and Pakistan. The pass connects Kābul with Peshāwar. The pass has historically been the gateway for invasions of the Indian subcontinent from the northwest.

questions.Question: The length of India's coastline is about ________
questions.solution: The length of India's coastline is about 7500 km. India measures 3,214 km (1,997 mi) from north to south and 2,933 km(1,822 mi) from east to west. It has a land frontier of 15,200 km (9,445 mi) and a coastline of 7,517 km (4,671 mi).

questions.Question:
Which of the statements given are correct?
1. The equatorial forests are evergreen.
2. The Mediterranean region has deciduous forests of broad-leaved trees.
3. Taiga forests are found in Kashmir.
questions.solution: All the statements given are correct. The equatorial forests are evergreen, the Mediterranean region has deciduous forests of broad-leaved trees and Taiga forests are found in Kashmir.

questions.Question:
Which of the following are true regarding Chhota Nagpur?
1. It is one of the former princely states.
2. It is a plateau area in Jharkhand inhabited mainly by the tribals.
3. It is a name given to the contiguous tribal areas in Bihar, West Bengal, Orissa and M.P.
questions.solution: The following that are true regarding Chhota Nagpur are that It is one of the former princely states and It is a plateau area in Jharkhand inhabited mainly by the tribals.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the correct sequence of the given hills starting from the north and going towards the south?
questions.optionA: Nallamalai Hills - Nilgiri Hills - Javadi Hilis - Anaimalai Hills
questions.optionB: Anaimalai Hills - Javadi Hills - Nilgiri Hills - Nallamalai Hills
questions.optionC: Nallamalai Hills - Javadi Hills - Nilgiri Hills - Anaimalai Hills
questions.optionD: Anaimalai Hills - Nilgiri Hills - Javadi Hills - Nallamalai Hills
questions.solution: The correct sequence of the given hills starting from the north and going towards the south are Nallamalai Hills - Javadi Hills - Nilgiri Hills - Anaimalai Hills.

questions.Question:
Which states of India have a common border with Pakistan?
I. Jammu and Kashmir
II. Himachal Pradesh
III. Punjab
IV. Gujarat
V. Rajasthan
questions.solution: The states of India that have a common border with Pakistan are Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab, Gujarat and Rajasthan.

questions.Question: Which of the following Indian state does not have any coastal border?
questions.solution: Gujarat, Goa and Maharashtra all lies on western coast of India that is adjacent to Arabian sea whereas Rajasthan shares land border with Pakistan. Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, Kerala, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu are the six state that lies on western coast of India.

questions.Question: The highest point in the Aravalli range is
questions.solution: The highest point in the Aravalli range is Guru Sikhar. Guru Shikhar, the highest peak in the Aravalli Range at 5650 feet (1722 meters) in Mount Abu of Rajasthan, lies near the south-western extremity of the Central Aravalli range, close to the border with Gujarat state.

questions.Question: The large States of India in the order of area are
questions.solution: The large States of India in the order of area are Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra. Rajasthan is a state in northern India. The state covers an area of 342,239 square kilometres (132,139 sq mi) or 10.4 percent of the total geographical area of India. Madhya Pradesh is a state in central India. Its total area is 308,252 km2. Maharashtra is a state in the western peninsular region of India occupying a substantial portion of the Deccan plateau. It is the second-most populous state and third-largest state by area in India. Spreadover 307,713 km2(118,809 sq mi).

questions.Question: With which of its neighbouring country India has Kalapani territorial dispute?
questions.solution: Kalapani is an area of 400 sq. km and is bone of contention between India and Nepal. In India, it lies in pithoragarh district of Uttrakhand.

questions.Question: The nations, separated by McMahon line are
questions.solution: McMahon line separates India from China. It stretches from eastern border of Bhutan to Brahamputra Gorge in the easternmost part of India near Namcha Barua.

questions.Question:
With which country India has signed a bilateral contract for development and operations of
Chabahar port?
questions.solution: Chabahar seaport is a port located in Gulf of Oman. India has signed a bilateral agreement with Iran to develop and operate this port. Development of this port will reduce India's dependency on Pakistan in terms of contact with Central Asia.

questions.Question: Which of the following state does not share boundary with Myanmar?
questions.solution: Assam does not share boundary with Myanmar. The states bordering Myanmar are Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, Nagaland and Mizoram.

questions.Question: The Portuguese possessions Goa, Daman and Diu were liberated in ________.
questions.solution: The Portuguese possessions Goa, Daman and Diu were liberated in 1961. The Annexation of Goa was the process in which the Republic of India annexed the former Portuguese Indian territories of Goa, Daman and Diu, starting with the "armed action" carried out by the Indian Armed Forces in December 1961. Depending on the view, this action is referred as the "Liberation of Goa" or the "Invasion of Goa". Following the end of Portuguese rule in 1961, Goa was placed under military administration headed by Kunhiraman Palat Candeth as Lieutenant Governor.

questions.Question: The Vindhyas belong to which class of mountains?
questions.solution: The Vindhyas belong to block mountains. Mountains are created when large areas or blocks of earth are broken and displaced vertically.

questions.Question: Which is Raisina Hills?
questions.optionB:
The Hill feature in Srinagar otherwise known
as Shnkara charya Bill
questions.optionC:
The place where the Dogra rulers of J & K built
their fort in Jammu
questions.optionD:
The rock feature at Kanyakumari where
Swami Vivekananda's statue was ereted
questions.solution: Raisina hills is an extension of Aravali hills in Delhi. Rashtrapati Bhavan is situated on these hills and hence often termed as Raisna Hills.

questions.Question: The Himalayas are formed of parallel fold ranges. Among them which is the oldest range?
questions.solution: The Himalayas are formed of parallel fold ranges. The range's total length is some 1,400 miles (2,300 km), and it has an average elevation of more than 20,000 feet (6,100 metres). The Great Himalayas contain many of the world's tallest peaks, including (from west to east) Nanga Parbat, Annapurna, Mount Everest, and Kanchenjunga.

questions.Question: One of the states not bisected by the Tropic of Cancer is
questions.solution: One of the states not bisected by the Tropic of Cancer is Odisha. Tropic of cancer passes through Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Tripura and Mizoram.

questions.Question: Zoji la pass connects
questions.solution: Zoji La pass is located on National highway ID between Srinagar and Leh. It is located 11,580 Ft. above the sea level.

questions.Question: ________ forms the western boundary of the Indian sub-continent.
questions.solution: Hindukush forms the western boundary of the Indian sub-continent. The mountain rage on the western boundary of the Indian Sub continent is called the Hindu Kush. The Hindu Kush is an 800 km long mountain range which stretches across the Afghanistan Pakistan border. It divides the valley of the Amu Darya in the north from the Indus River valley to the south.

questions.Question: Name the longest lake in India
questions.solution: Vembanad is the longest lake in India. It's length streches upto 96.5km and width of this lake is about 14km and it is the largest lake in the state of Kerala.

questions.Question: The Patkai hills belong to which mountain ranges?
questions.solution: Patkai hills are part of Purvanchal hills in North-Eastern part of India. Patkai includes three hills namely - (i) Patkai Bum (ii) Garo-Khasi-Jaintia (iii) Lushai hills

questions.Question: Maharashtrian Plateau is made up of ________
questions.solution: Maharashtrian Plateau is made up of lava.

questions.Question: Why is that India has one of the lowest agricultural yields in the world?
questions.optionC: Farmers being poor and illiterate do not use modern farming techniques
questions.solution: India has one of the lowest agricultural yields in the world because farmers being poor and illiterate do not use modern farming techniques. Indian farmers are facing the problem of low income from their marketable surplus crops in the absence of proper organized markets and adequate transportation facilities. Scattered and sub-divided holdings are also creating serious problem for marketing their products.

questions.Question: Which one of the following towns is situated easternmost?
questions.solution: Dibrugarh, northeastern Assam state, northeastern India. It is situated in a valley along the Brahmaputra River. Dibrugarh is an important commercial centre, a port, and a rail terminus. Its industries include tea processing and rice and oilseed milling.

questions.Question: Kodaikanal, the famous hill-station of South India, is situated on ________
questions.solution: Kodaikanal, the famous hill-station of South India, is situated on Palni hills. Its name in the Tamil language means "The Gift of the Forest". Kodaikanal is referred to as the "Princess of Hill stations" and has a long history as a retreat and popular tourist destination.

questions.Question: The most urbanised community in India is that of the ________
questions.solution: The most urbanised community in India is that of the Zoroastrians. Zoroastrianism in India has significant history within the country. The initial migration following the Muslim conquest of Persia has been canonized as a religious persecution by invading Muslims. Zoroastrianism meanwhile suffered a decline in Iran after the conquests.

questions.Question:
Which of the following passes and locations is/are wrongly matched?
1. Zojila and Burzil - Jammu & Kashmir
2. Bara Lapcha La and Shipki La - Uttar Pradesh
3. Thaga La, Niti Pass and Lipu Lekh - Himachal Pradesh
4. Nathu La and Jelep La - Sikkim
questions.solution: The following passes and locations that are wrongly matched are Bara Lapcha La and Shipki La - Uttar Pradesh and Thaga La, Niti Pass and Lipu Lekh - Himachal Pradesh. Bara-lacha la is a high mountain pass in Zanskar range, connecting Lahaul district in Himachal Pradesh to Ladakh in Jammu and Kashmir, situated along the Leh–Manali Highway. The Shipki La Pass or Shipki Pass is a hill pass in India. It also serves as the boundary post on the frontier between China and India. Niti Pass is an international high mountain pass at an elevation of 5.070m (16,633ft) connecting Uttarakhand, a state in the northern part of India and southern Tibet, an autonomous region of the People's Republic of China. Lipulekh is a Himalayan pass on the border between Uttarakhand, India and Tibet, China. The southern side of the pass is controlled by India but claimed by Nepal.

questions.Question: The capital of Lakshadweep is ________
questions.solution: Kavaratti is the capital of the union territory Lakshadweep in India. The Island of Kavaratti lies 360 Km of the coast of the State of Kerala at 10.57°N 72.64°E.

questions.Question: Which of the following mountain range is located in India?
questions.solution: Pir Panjal Range, mountain range in the northern Indian subcontinent. It is part of the western (Punjab) Himalayas, the western outlier of the vast Himalayas system.

questions.Question: Nine Degree Channel separates ________
questions.solution: Nine Degree Channel separates Lakshadweep and Minicoy. The Nine Degree Channel is a channel in the Indian Ocean between the Laccadive Islands of Kalpeni and Suheli Par, and Maliku Atoll. These two subgroups of islands, together with the Amindivi Subgroup, form the Indian Union Territory (UT) of Lakshadweep.

questions.Question: Badland topography is characteristic of
questions.solution: Badland topography is characteristic of Chambal valley. Badland topography is a topography with deep vertical ravines due tovertical erosion caused by river. Rivers such as Chambal when flows through Malwa region makes headward or vertical erosion to cut deep ravines. These ravines wereused by dacoits to hide from police.

questions.Question: The Lakshadweep Islands are situated in ________
questions.solution: The Lakshadweep Islands are situated in Arabian Sea. Lakshadweep, formerly (1956–73) Laccadive, Minicoy, and Amindivi Islands, union territory of India. It is a group of some three dozen islands scattered over some 30,000 square miles (78,000 square km) of the Arabian Sea off the southwestern coast of India.

questions.Question: How many islands are there in Lakshadweep?
questions.solution: Lakshadweep is a coral archipelago which consists 36 islands. Its capital is Kavaratti. It is a group of about 36 islands and has a total land area of 32 square kilometers which is scattered over 30,000 square miles of the Arabian Sea. Out of the 36 islands, only ten are inhabited and they are Andrott, Amini, Agatti, Bitra, Chetlat, Kadmat, Kalpeni, Kavaratti, Kiltan and Minicoy.

questions.Question: Lakshadweep Islands are the product of ________
questions.solution: Lakshadweep Islands are the product of Reef formation. Lakshadweep is an archipelago of twelve atolls, three reefs and five submerged banks, with a total of about thirty-nine islands and islets.

questions.Question: Which one of the following is the southern-most city ?
questions.solution: Raipur is the southern-most city. Raipur city had been the capital of the Haihaya Kings, controlling the traditional forts of the Chhattisgarh for a long time. The town of Raipur has been in existence since the 9th century. The old site and ruins of the fort can be seen in the southern part of the city.

questions.Question: Which one among the following is nearest to the Tropic of Cancer?
questions.solution: Jhansi among the following is nearest to the Tropic of Cancer.

questions.Question: Among the following cities, which one is nearest to the Tropic of Cancer?
questions.solution: Among the following cities, Kolkata one is nearest to the Tropic of Cancer. Distance between Kolkata, India and the Tropic of Cancer, 97 km = 61 miles.

questions.Question:
Select the following correct statements regarding Andaman and Nicobar Islands:
1. It enjoys equatorial climate
2. This is the only place in India where a volcano is located
3. This is the only place in India where coral bed is found
questions.solution: The following statements are correct regarding Andaman and Nicobar Islands - it enjoys equatorial climate and this is the only place in India where a volcano is located.

questions.Question: Beyond the ________ ,the Himalayas bend sharply to the south and spread along the eastern boundary of India.
questions.solution: Himalayas take a sharp turn to south after Dihang gorge. Dihang gorge is a narrow valley formed by Brahmaputra river.

questions.Question: Which of the following hill stations is not located in Himachal Pradesh?
questions.solution: Ranikhet hill stations is not located in Himachal Pradesh. It is a serene and beautiful hill station built up by British and is situated in Almora district in the state of Uttaranchal.

questions.Question: In India, how many States share the coastline?
questions.solution: The total coastline of India measures about 7,517 km, which is distributed among nine coastal states and four Union Territories; and almost entire coast of India falls within tropics. The nine coastal states are Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Odisha and West Bengal

questions.Question: A famous hill station in Uttarakhand is
questions.solution: Nainital is the most popular hill stations in Uttarakhand. Situated at an elevation of 1,938 m above the sea-level, the quaint hill station is best known for the Naina Devi temple & the Naini Lake that lies amidst a forested valley.

questions.Question: Arakan Yoma is the extension of the Himalayas located in ________
questions.solution: Arakan Yoma is the extension of the Himalayas located in Myanmar. The Arakan Mountains are also known as the Rakhine Mountains. These are a mountain range in western Myanmar, between the coast of Rakhine State and the Central Myanmar Basin, in which the Irrawaddy River flows.

questions.Question: Correct pair of the state and its capital is
questions.solution: State -Capital Nagaland - Kohima Jharkhand - Ranchi Uttarakhand - Dehradun Chattisgarh - Atalnagar

questions.Question: West Bengal makes borders with how many countries?
questions.solution: West Bengal shares boundaries with three foreign countries. The state has international boundaries with Bangladesh in the east, Bhutan and Nepal in the north.

questions.Question: Bangladesh does not share its border with which Indian state?
questions.solution: Bangladesh does not share its border with which Indian state Jharkand. Indian states that shares their border with Bangladesh are:- West Bengal, Tripura, Assam, Meghalya and Mizoram.

questions.Question:
Arrange the following cities in an order from North to South-
1. Bhubaneshwar
2. Chennai
3. Hyderabad
4. Cochin
questions.solution: Bhubaneshwar, Hyderabad, Chennai and Cochin.

questions.Question: The land mass of lndia has an area of ________ million square km.
questions.solution: Area of India is 3.28 million sq.km which includes Pakistan occupied Kashmir (POK) and Aksai Chin under illegal occupation of China.

questions.Question: Which group of following states shares the boundary with Nagaland?
questions.solution: States sharing their borders with Nagaland are Arunachal Pradesh, Assam & Manipur. Its capital is Kohima.

questions.Question: Which of the following Indian States broadly as large as the European nation Poland?
questions.solution: Madhya pradesh is broadly as large as the European nation Poland. Madhya Pradesh means middle province, and it is located in the geographic heart of India. Except for the valleys of the Narmada and the Tapti, Madhya Pradesh consists of a plateau with a mean elevation of 1600 ft above sea level, interspersed with the mountains of the Vindhya and the Satpura ranges.

questions.Question: For transporting large quantities of crude oil on land, over long distances the most economical mode is
questions.solution: For transporting large quantities of crude oil on land, over long distances the most economic model is by pipelines. Pipelines are generally the most economical way to transport large quantities of oil, refined oil products or natural gas over land. For example, in 2014, pipeline transport of crude oil cost about $5 per barrel, while rail transport cost about $10 to $15 per barrel.

questions.Question: Which among the following districts is not situated in the terai of Uttar pradesh?
questions.solution: Hardoi district of Lucknow administrative division does not fall in the terai of UP, Terai is a water logged region having small sized sediments good for agriculture and lies just below the Bhabar region.

questions.Question: Which of the following state is the member of "Seven Sisters"?
questions.solution: Orissa is the member of "Seven Sisters". Seven Sisters include Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Meghalya and Assam.

questions.Question: Which one of the following pairs is correctly matched?
questions.solution: Radcliffe Line : India and Pakistan is correctly matched. The Radcliffe Line was the boundary demarcation line between the Indian and Pakistani portions of the Punjab and Bengal provinces of British India.

questions.Question: Where is Anaimudi peak located?
questions.solution: Anaimudi is the highest peak of Peninsular India. It is located in the state of Kerala in Western Ghats (Sahyadri). It lies near Anamalai and Cardamom hills.

questions.Question: Which one among the following major Indian cities is most eastward located?
questions.solution: Lucknow is most eastward located. Lucknow, the capital of Uttar Pradesh, lies in the middle of the Heritage Arc. It is home to extraordinary monuments depicting a fascinating blend of ancient, colonial and oriental architecture.

questions.Question: The States of India having common border with Myanmar are ________
questions.solution: The States of India having common border with Myanmar are Mizoram, Manipur, Nagaland and Arunachal Pradesh.

questions.Question: Duncan Passage is situated between ________
questions.solution: Duncan Passage is situated between South Andaman and Little Andaman. Duncan pass is located between South and little Andaman. Duncan Passage is a strait in the Indian Ocean. It is about 48 km (30 mi) wide; it separates Rutland Island (part of Great Andaman) to the north, and Little Andaman to the south. West of Duncan Passage is the Bay of Bengal, east is the Andaman Sea.
